document.docAuthor: Lim, Jongok, Lee, Jongwook, Koh, Sanghyun, Lee, Bongwoo, Azevedo, Celso O. & Lee, Seunghwan
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of Epyris Westwood (Hymenoptera: Bethylidae) from Korea, with the descriptions of ten new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of Epyris Westwood (Hymenoptera: Bethylidae) from Korea, with the descriptions of ten new species

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 106–115.
Epyris yamatonis
(male). 106. Habitus; 107. Head; 108. Mandible and clypeus; 109. Antenna; 110. Pronotum and mesonotum; 111. Fore wing; 112. Propodeum; 113. Metasoma; 114. Genitalia, ventral view; 115. Hypopygium. Scale bar: 0.10 mm for 114, 115; 0.20 mm for 107–110, 112; 0.50 mm for 111, 113; 1.00 mm for 106.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 116–123.
Epyris yamatonis
(female). 116. Habitus; 117. Antenna; 118. Fore wing; 119. Head; 120. Mandible and clypeus; 121. Pronotum and mesonotum; 122. Metasoma; 123. Propodeum. Scale bar: 0.20 mm for 117, 120; 0.30 mm for 119, 121, 123; 0.50 mm for 118, 122; 1.00 mm for 116.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation . Mandible of some specimens with castaneous apex; labial and maxillar palpi castaneous to dark castaneous; tibia pale to dark castaneous; TL 3.56–4.15 mm ; LP 0.58–0.62 × WP; propodeal disc 0.55–0.61 × as long as wide; scutellar pit separated from each other by 0.48–0.54 × as its maximum diameter.
Variation . Mandible of some specimens with black base; metasoma with distal black band; TL 4.2–5.1 mm ; LP 0.56–0.70 × WP; propodeal disc 0.6–0.67 × as long as wide.
Distribution. Korea (GG, CB, CN, GB, GN, JJ), Japan (Honshu, Shikoku, Kyushu, Yaku-shima, South Ryukyu).

Remarks . The male and female are mophologically differ from each other by ratio of head, ratio of each antennal segment, but these characters are common sexual dimorphism in the genus
Epyris
. We found some regular morphological patterns of this unique species among the congeneric species. We regard the male and female as an opposite sexes of one species because they have such common characters as head and pronotal disc microreticulate with relatively shallow but big puctures, anterior margin with round angle, mandible with two teeth, fore wing without metacarpus, same sculpture and carinae on propodeal disc.
